api/BOOSE.aboutBOOSE.html.title: Class aboutBOOSE | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSE.aboutBOOSE.html.summary: Class aboutBOOSE Namespace BOOSE Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Provides information about the BOOSE library, including version details and a general description of its functionality. public static class aboutBOOSE Inheritance object aboutBOOSE Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods About() Returns a descriptive message about the BOOSE library, including version information and supported drawing commands. public static string About() Returns string A formatted string containing version number, success message, and a brief description of the library's purpose.

api/BOOSE.html.summary: Namespace BOOSE Classes aboutBOOSE Provides information about the BOOSE library, including version details and a general description of its functionality.

api/BOOSEapp.AppArray.html.title: Class AppArray | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppArray.html.summary: Class AppArray Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a fixed-length array value in the BOOSE application. Stores numeric elements as AppValue objects. public sealed class AppArray : AppValue Inheritance object AppValue AppArray Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppArray(int) Initializes a new integer array with the specified length. public AppArray(int length) Parameters length int The number of elements in the array. AppArray(int, string) Initializes a new instance of the AppArray class with the specified length and element type. public AppArray(int length, string elementType) Parameters length int The number of elements in the array. elementType string The numeric type of the elements. Exceptions ArgumentOutOfRangeException Thrown when the length is less than or equal to zero. Properties ElementType Gets the type of elements stored in the array ("int" or "real"). public string ElementType { get; } Property Value string Length Gets the number of elements in the array. public int Length { get; } Property Value int TypeName Gets the type name of this value. public override string TypeName { get; } Property Value string Methods Get(int) Retrieves the value at the specified index. public AppValue Get(int index) Parameters index int The zero-based index of the element. Returns AppValue The AppValue stored at the index. Exceptions IndexOutOfRangeException Thrown when the index is outside the valid range. Set(int, AppValue) Sets the value at the specified index. public void Set(int index, AppValue value) Parameters index int The zero-based index of the element. value AppValue The value to assign. Exceptions IndexOutOfRangeException Thrown when the index is outside the valid range.

api/BOOSEapp.AppBool.html.title: Class AppBool | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppBool.html.summary: Class AppBool Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a boolean value in the BOOSE application. public sealed class AppBool : AppValue Inheritance object AppValue AppBool Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Constructors AppBool(bool) Initializes a new instance of the AppBool class with the specified boolean value. public AppBool(bool value) Parameters value bool The boolean value to store. Properties TypeName Gets the type name of this value. public override string TypeName { get; } Property Value string Value Gets the boolean value stored in this instance. public bool Value { get; } Property Value bool Methods ToString() Returns the string representation of the boolean value. public override string ToString() Returns string "true" if the value is true; otherwise, "false".

api/BOOSEapp.AppCanvas.html.title: Class AppCanvas | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppCanvas.html.summary: Class AppCanvas Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a simple drawing canvas used by the BOOSE application. Provides drawing primitives such as lines, shapes, text, and bitmap access. Maintains an internal cursor position for drawing operations. public class AppCanvas Inheritance object AppCanvas Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCanvas(int, int) Initializes a new instance of the AppCanvas class with the specified dimensions. public AppCanvas(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the canvas in pixels. Must be greater than zero. height int The height of the canvas in pixels. Must be greater than zero. Properties Xpos Gets or sets the current X-position of the drawing cursor. public int Xpos { get; set; } Property Value int Ypos Gets or sets the current Y-position of the drawing cursor. public int Ypos { get; set; } Property Value int Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws a circle centered at the current cursor position. public void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle. filled bool Indicates whether the circle should be filled. Clear() Clears the canvas by filling it with white. public void Clear() DrawTo(int, int) Draws a line from the current cursor position to the specified coordinates, then updates the cursor to the new location. public void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The target X coordinate. y int The target Y coordinate. GetBitmap() Gets the backing bitmap for rendering or exporting. public Bitmap GetBitmap() Returns Bitmap The current canvas bitmap. LoadImage(Bitmap) Loads the provided bitmap into the canvas, replacing its current contents public void LoadImage(Bitmap bmp) Parameters bmp Bitmap The bitmap to load into the canvas. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when bmp is null. MoveTo(int, int) Moves the drawing cursor to the specified coordinates without drawing. public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The X coordinate. y int The Y coordinate. Rect(int, int, bool) Draws a rectangle starting from the current cursor position. public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int The rectangle width. height int The rectangle height. filled bool Indicates whether the rectangle should be filled. Reset() Resets the cursor position to the origin (0, 0). public void Reset() Set(int, int) Resizes the canvas to the specified width and height. This operation clears the canvas and resets its bitmap. public void Set(int width, int height) Parameters width int The new canvas width. height int The new canvas height. SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the drawing color for both the pen and brush. public void SetColour(int r, int g2, int b) Parameters r int Red component (0–255). g2 int Green component (0–255). b int Blue component (0–255). Tri(int, int) Draws a triangle with the base starting at the cursor position and the apex above the base, forming an isosceles triangle. public void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the triangle base. height int The height of the triangle. WriteText(string) Writes a text string using the current brush at the cursor position. public void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string The text to render. getBitmap() Gets the backing bitmap (legacy method for compatibility) public Bitmap getBitmap() Returns Bitmap The current canvas bitmap.

api/BOOSEapp.AppCircle.html.title: Class AppCircle | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppCircle.html.summary: Class AppCircle Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a command that draws an unfilled circle on the canvas using the specified radius (int or real) and the current cursor position. public class AppCircle : IAppCommand Inheritance object AppCircle Implements IAppCommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCircle(AppCanvas, double) Initializes a new instance of the AppCircle command public AppCircle(AppCanvas c, double radius) Parameters c AppCanvas The target AppCanvas to draw onto. radius double The radius of the circle (real or int). Methods Execute() Executes the circle-drawing command on the associated canvas. Draws a non-filled circle at the current cursor position. public void Execute()

api/BOOSEapp.AppCircleCmd.html.summary: Class AppCircleCmd Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Command that draws a circle on the canvas. public sealed class AppCircleCmd : IAppCommand Inheritance object AppCircleCmd Implements IAppCommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCircleCmd(AppCanvas, int) Initializes a new circle command. public AppCircleCmd(AppCanvas canvas, int radius) Parameters canvas AppCanvas The canvas to operate on. radius int The radius of the circle. api/BOOSEapp.AppCommandFactory.html.title: Class AppCommandFactory | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppCommandFactory.html.summary: Class AppCommandFactory Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Factory class responsible for creating executable drawing commands based on parsed command strings. public class AppCommandFactory Inheritance object AppCommandFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCommandFactory(AppCanvas) Initializes a new instance of the AppCommandFactory class. public AppCommandFactory(AppCanvas c) Parameters c AppCanvas The drawing canvas. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when the canvas is null. Methods CreateCommand(string) Creates a command from a command line string. This method is kept for backward compatibility. public IAppCommand CreateCommand(string commandLine) Parameters commandLine string The raw command string. Returns IAppCommand A no-operation command. CreateCommand(string, AppExecutionContext) Creates a command from a command line string using the provided execution context. public IAppCommand CreateCommand(string commandLine, AppExecutionContext ctx) Parameters commandLine string The raw command string. ctx AppExecutionContext The execution context for expression evaluation. Returns IAppCommand An executable application command.

Methods Execute() Executes the draw-to operation. public void Execute()

api/BOOSEapp.AppExecutionContext.html.title: Class AppExecutionContext | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppExecutionContext.html.summary: Class AppExecutionContext Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Provides the execution context for the BOOSE application. Manages canvas access, output display, variables, methods, and expression evaluation. public class AppExecutionContext Inheritance object AppExecutionContext Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppExecutionContext(AppCanvas, RichTextBox) Initializes a new execution context with a single output box. public AppExecutionContext(AppCanvas canvas, RichTextBox outputBox) Parameters canvas AppCanvas The drawing canvas. outputBox RichTextBox The output text box. AppExecutionContext(AppCanvas, RichTextBox, RichTextBox) Initializes a new execution context with two output boxes. public AppExecutionContext(AppCanvas canvas, RichTextBox outputBox1, RichTextBox outputBox2) Parameters canvas AppCanvas The drawing canvas. outputBox1 RichTextBox The primary output text box. outputBox2 RichTextBox The secondary output text box. Properties Canvas Gets the drawing canvas associated with this execution context. public AppCanvas Canvas { get; } Property Value AppCanvas OutputBox Gets the primary output text box. public RichTextBox OutputBox { get; } Property Value RichTextBox OutputBox2 Gets the optional secondary output text box. public RichTextBox? OutputBox2 { get; } Property Value RichTextBox Vars Gets the variable store used during execution. public AppVariableStore Vars { get; } Property Value AppVariableStore Methods EvalBool(string) Evaluates a token as a boolean value. public bool EvalBool(string token) Parameters token string The token to evaluate. Returns bool A boolean result. EvalBoolExpression(string) public bool EvalBoolExpression(string expr) Parameters expr string Returns bool EvalInt(string) Evaluates a token as an integer value. public int EvalInt(string token) Parameters token string The token to evaluate. Returns int An integer result. EvalIntExpression(string) Evaluates an arithmetic expression and returns an integer result. public int EvalIntExpression(string expr) Parameters expr string The expression to evaluate. Returns int An integer value. EvalReal(string) Evaluates a token as a real (double) value. public double EvalReal(string token) Parameters token string The token to evaluate. Returns double A double result. EvalRealExpression(string) Evaluates an arithmetic expression and returns a real value. Supports +, -, *, and / operators. public double EvalRealExpression(string expr) Parameters expr string The expression to evaluate. Returns double A double result. Print(string) Prints a message to the output text box(es) and debug output. public void Print(string message) Parameters message string The message to print.

api/BOOSEapp.AppFor.html.title: Class AppFor | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppFor.html.summary: Class AppFor Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Executes a FOR loop: for var = start to end step stepValue ... end for Supports positive/negative step and prevents infinite loops. public sealed class AppFor Inheritance object AppFor Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppFor(AppExecutionContext, string, string, string, string, List<string>, int) public AppFor(AppExecutionContext context, string variableName, string startExpression, string endExpression, string stepExpression, List<string> body, int maxIterations = 100000) Parameters context AppExecutionContext variableName string startExpression string endExpression string stepExpression string body List<string> maxIterations int Methods Execute(AppParser) public void Execute(AppParser parser) Parameters parser AppParser

Methods AddLine(string) Adds a line of code to the IF or ELSE block. public void AddLine(string line) Parameters line string The line of code to add. Execute() Evaluates the condition and executes the appropriate block. public void Execute()

api/BOOSEapp.AppNoOp.html.title: Class AppNoOp | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppNoOp.html.summary: Class AppNoOp Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a no-operation command in the BOOSE application. Optionally outputs a message when executed. public sealed class AppNoOp : IAppCommand Inheritance object AppNoOp Implements IAppCommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppNoOp() Initializes a new instance of the AppNoOp class with no message or execution context. public AppNoOp() AppNoOp(string, AppExecutionContext?) Initializes a new instance of the AppNoOp class with an optional message and execution context. public AppNoOp(string msg, AppExecutionContext? ctx = null) Parameters msg string The message to display. ctx AppExecutionContext The execution context for printing. Methods Execute() Executes the command. Prints the message if a context is available. public void Execute()

api/BOOSEapp.AppParser.html.title: Class AppParser | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppParser.html.summary: Class AppParser Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Parses and executes BOOSE script text. Supports commands, variable declarations, assignments, output writing, arrays (peek/poke), and control structures (for/while/if) with nesting. public class AppParser Inheritance object AppParser Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppParser(AppExecutionContext, AppCommandFactory) Initializes a new instance of the AppParser class. public AppParser(AppExecutionContext context, AppCommandFactory commandFactory) Parameters context AppExecutionContext The execution context. commandFactory AppCommandFactory The command factory. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when a required argument is null. Methods RunProgram(string) Runs a BOOSE program from a string containing one or more lines. Normalizes newlines, removes comments and blank lines, joins continuation lines, and executes the resulting statements. public void RunProgram(string programText) Parameters programText string The program text to execute.

api/BOOSEapp.AppPeek.html.title: Class AppPeek | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppPeek.html.summary: Class AppPeek Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Implements the PEEK operation for the BOOSE application. Supports reading and printing variable values, reading array elements, and optionally assigning an array element to a target variable. public sealed class AppPeek Inheritance object AppPeek Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppPeek(AppExecutionContext, string) Initializes a new instance of the AppPeek class for printing a single variable value (Mode A: "peek x"). public AppPeek(AppExecutionContext context, string varName) Parameters context AppExecutionContext The execution context. varName string The name of the variable to peek. AppPeek(AppExecutionContext, string, string) Initializes a new instance of the AppPeek class for printing an array element (Mode B: "peek arr expr"). public AppPeek(AppExecutionContext context, string arrName, string arrIndexExpr) Parameters context AppExecutionContext The execution context. arrName string The name of the array variable. arrIndexExpr string The index expression for the array access. AppPeek(AppExecutionContext, string, string, string) Initializes a new instance of the AppPeek class for assigning an array element into a target variable and printing it (Mode C: "peek x = arr expr"). public AppPeek(AppExecutionContext context, string target, string arrName, string arrIndexExpr) Parameters context AppExecutionContext The execution context. target string The target variable name. arrName string The name of the array variable. arrIndexExpr string The index expression for the array access. Methods Execute() Executes the peek operation based on the configured mode. Mode A prints a variable value. Mode B prints an array element value. Mode C assigns an array element to a target variable and prints it. public void Execute()

Methods Execute() Executes the command, updating the canvas pen to the specified RGB color. public void Execute()

api/BOOSEapp.AppPoke.html.title: Class AppPoke | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppPoke.html.summary: Class AppPoke Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Implements the POKE operation for the BOOSE application. Supports assigning values to variables and setting elements inside arrays. public sealed class AppPoke Inheritance object AppPoke Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppPoke(AppExecutionContext, string, string, string?) Initializes a new instance of the AppPoke class. public AppPoke(AppExecutionContext context, string varName, string valueExpression, string? arrayIndexExpression = null) Parameters context AppExecutionContext The execution context. varName string The variable or array name. valueExpression string The expression producing the value to assign. arrayIndexExpression string Optional array index expression for array element assignment. Methods Execute() Executes the poke operation. If an index expression is provided, assigns the evaluated value into an array element. Otherwise, assigns the evaluated value into an existing int/real variable. public void Execute()

api/BOOSEapp.AppVariableStore.html.title: Class AppVariableStore | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppVariableStore.html.summary: Class AppVariableStore Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Manages storage and access of variables used in the BOOSE application. Provides methods for declaring, setting, and retrieving variables. public sealed class AppVariableStore Inheritance object AppVariableStore Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Declare(string, AppValue) Declares a new variable with the specified name and value. public void Declare(string name, AppValue value) Parameters name string The variable name. value AppValue The initial value of the variable. Exists(string) Determines whether a variable with the specified name exists. public bool Exists(string name) Parameters name string The variable name. Returns bool True if the variable exists; otherwise, false. Get(string) Retrieves the value of a declared variable. public AppValue Get(string name) Parameters name string The variable name. Returns AppValue The value associated with the variable. Set(string, AppValue) Sets the value of an existing variable. public void Set(string name, AppValue value) Parameters name string The variable name. value AppValue The new value to assign. SetOrDeclare(string, AppValue) Sets the value of a variable, declaring it if it does not already exist. Used by the parser to allow implicit variable creation. public void SetOrDeclare(string name, AppValue value) Parameters name string The variable name. value AppValue The value to assign. TryGet(string, out AppValue) Attempts to retrieve the value of a variable. public bool TryGet(string name, out AppValue value) Parameters name string The variable name. value AppValue When this method returns, contains the variable value if found. Returns bool True if the variable exists; otherwise, false.

api/BOOSEapp.AppWhile.html.title: Class AppWhile | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppWhile.html.summary: Class AppWhile Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Executes a WHILE loop using the current execution context. Holds the loop condition and the body lines to execute. public sealed class AppWhile Inheritance object AppWhile Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppWhile(AppExecutionContext, string, List<string>, int) Initializes a new instance of the AppWhile class. public AppWhile(AppExecutionContext context, string conditionExpression, List<string> body, int maxIterations = 10000) Parameters context AppExecutionContext The execution context. conditionExpression string The boolean condition expression. body List<string> The list of lines forming the loop body. maxIterations int The maximum number of iterations allowed before stopping execution. Methods Execute(AppParser) Executes the WHILE loop. The loop continues while the condition evaluates to true. public void Execute(AppParser parser) Parameters parser AppParser The parser used to execute the loop body, allowing nested control structures.

api/BOOSEapp.IAppCommand.html.title: Interface IAppCommand | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.IAppCommand.html.summary: Interface IAppCommand Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Defines a command that can be executed within the BOOSE application. public interface IAppCommand Methods Execute() Executes the command. void Execute()

api/BOOSEapp.ScriptEngine.html.title: Class ScriptEngine | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.ScriptEngine.html.summary: Class ScriptEngine Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll ScriptEngine supports BOTH method styles: STYLE A (BOOSE example): method int mulMethod int one, int two mulMethod = one * two end method STYLE B (single-line header): method int mulMethod int one, int two mulMethod = one * two end method Also supports common drawing commands: moveto, drawto, circle, rect, write (circle/rect default to outline, not filled). public sealed class ScriptEngine Inheritance object ScriptEngine Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors ScriptEngine(AppCanvas, Action<string>) Initializes a new instance of the ScriptEngine class. public ScriptEngine(AppCanvas canvas, Action<string> log) Parameters canvas AppCanvas The canvas used for drawing. log Action<string> A callback used for logging messages. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when the canvas is null. Methods Execute(string) Executes the provided script text. First parses and stores all methods, then executes the non-method lines. public void Execute(string script) Parameters script string The script text to execute. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when the script is null.

api/BOOSEapp.html.title: Namespace BOOSEapp | BOOSE-docs
api/BOOSEapp.html.summary: Namespace BOOSEapp Classes AppArray Represents a fixed-length array value in the BOOSE application. Stores numeric elements as AppValue objects. AppBool Represents a boolean value in the BOOSE application. AppCanvas Represents a simple drawing canvas used by the BOOSE application. Provides drawing primitives such as lines, shapes, text, and bitmap access. Maintains an internal cursor position for drawing operations. AppCircle Represents a command that draws an unfilled circle on the canvas using the specified radius (int or real) and the current cursor position. AppCircleCmd Command that draws a circle on the canvas. AppClearCmd Command that clears the canvas. AppCommandFactory Factory class responsible for creating executable drawing commands based on parsed command strings. AppDrawToCmd Command that draws a line from the current position to a specified position. AppExecutionContext Provides the execution context for the BOOSE application. Manages canvas access, output display, variables, methods, and expression evaluation. AppFor Executes a FOR loop: for var = start to end step stepValue ... end for Supports positive/negative step and prevents infinite loops. AppIf Represents an IF–ELSE control structure in the BOOSE application. Evaluates a boolean condition and executes the corresponding block. AppInt Represents an integer value in the BOOSE application. AppMethod Represents a user-defined method in the BOOSE script. Example: method int mulMethod int one, int two mulMethod = one * two end method AppMoveTo Represents a command that moves the drawing cursor to a specified (x, y) position on the AppCanvas without drawing. AppMoveToCmd Command that moves the drawing cursor to a specified position without drawing a line. AppNoOp Represents a no-operation command in the BOOSE application. Optionally outputs a message when executed. AppParser Parses and executes BOOSE script text. Supports commands, variable declarations, assignments, output writing, arrays (peek/poke), and control structures (for/while/if) with nesting. AppPeek Implements the PEEK operation for the BOOSE application. Supports reading and printing variable values, reading array elements, and optionally assigning an array element to a target variable. AppPen Represents a command that changes the drawing pen color on the AppCanvas using RGB values. AppPenCmd Command that sets the drawing pen colour. AppPoke Implements the POKE operation for the BOOSE application. Supports assigning values to variables and setting elements inside arrays. AppReal Represents a real (double-precision) numeric value in the BOOSE application. AppRect Represents a command that draws a rectangle on the AppCanvas using the specified width and height. AppRectCmd Command that draws a rectangle on the canvas. AppResetCmd Command that resets the canvas state. AppValue Represents the base class for all value types used in the BOOSE application. AppVariableStore Manages storage and access of variables used in the BOOSE application. Provides methods for declaring, setting, and retrieving variables. AppWhile Executes a WHILE loop using the current execution context. Holds the loop condition and the body lines to execute. DebugLogger Provides a simple singleton-based logger for writing debug messages. Form1 Main Windows Forms interface for the BOOSE drawing application. Handles program execution, command parsing, canvas rendering, and file operations for both programs and images. ScriptEngine ScriptEngine supports BOTH method styles: STYLE A (BOOSE example): method int mulMethod int one, int two mulMethod = one * two end method STYLE B (single-line header): method int mulMethod int one, int two mulMethod = one * two end method Also supports common drawing commands: moveto, drawto, circle, rect, write (circle/rect default to outline, not filled). Interfaces IAppCommand Defines a command that can be executed within the BOOSE application.

index.html.title: This is the HOMEPAGE. | BOOSE-docs
index.html.summary: This is the HOMEPAGE. Refer to Markdown for how to write markdown files. Quick Start Notes: Add images to the images folder if the file is referencing an image.
